newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - Washington Post front - March 11.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Washington Post front - March 11.

text.p: The Washington Post carried the following stories on its front page on Tuesday:

WASHINGTON - The White House and the FBI offered sharply conflicting versions of their contacts with each other concerning evidence of a Chinese plan to influence U.S. congressional elections last year.

WASHINGTON - An overwhelming majority of Americans disapprove of President Bill Clinton's use of the White House to help raise campaign funds and the controversy has begun to whittle away his approval rating, according to a new poll.
WASHINGTON - District of Columbia Council Chairman David Clarke has been diagnosed with central nervous system lymphoma, a fatal form of brain cancer.
WASHINGTON - An attorney for the House Commerce Committee also played a key role in raising $100,000 in contributions for the Republican Party.
PARIS - Paralyzed and unable to speak, French journalist Jean-Dominique Bauby completed a book by blinking his eyelid in code before his death of heart failure on Sunday.
WASHINGTON - Virginia's emphasis on a traditional approach to teaching history is beginning to gain national recognition.
WASHINGTON - The Federal Trade Commission said it will block the proposed merger of Office Depot Inc and Staples Inc, two of the nation's biggest office supply dealers.
